name: Major Dimension Eye Illusion Eyeshadow Duo
about: What it is:A shimmering eyeshadow duo that illuminates eyes with super-fine sparkles and multidimensional pearl pigments..Ingredient Callouts:Free of parabens, formaldehydes, formaldehyde-releasing agents, phthalates, mineral oil, retinyl palmitate, oxybenzone, coal tar, hydroquinone, sulfates SLS & SLES, triclocarban, triclosan, and contains less than one percent synthetic fragrance. It is also vegan, gluten-free, cruelty-free, and comes in recyclable packaging..What Else You Need to Know:This duo makes everyday eye makeup an editorial moment. High-wattage shimmer and light-catching pigments lay down effortlessly over lids for a sophisticated sparkle. The shades within each of the five duos love to be layered for major dimension, blending and building from sheer to opaque. The gel-like, translucent base of the formula lends to color that's true on every skin tone‚Äînever dull or ashy.
ingredients: Shade 1:.Calcium Aluminum Borosilicate, Mica, Calcium Sodium Borosilicate, Calcium Titanium Borosilicate, Cetearyl Ethylhexanoate, Synthetic Fluorphlogopite, Glycerin, Silica, Hydrolyzed Rice Protein, Water/Aqua/Eau, Squalane, Calcium Chloride, Tin Oxide, Gellan Gum, Sodium Citrate, 1,2-Hexanediol, Sodium Isostearate, Xanthan Gum, Pentaerythrityl Tetra-Di-T-Butyl Hydroxyhydrocinnamate, Caprylyl Glycol, Polysorbate 20, Ethylhexylglycerin, Titanium Dioxide (CI 77891), Iron Oxides (CI 77491)...Shade 2:.Synthetic Fluorphlogopite, Silica, Cetearyl Ethylhexanoate, Glycerin, Hydrolyzed Rice Protein, Water/Aqua/Eau, Squalane, Calcium Sodium Borosilicate, Calcium Chloride, Tin Oxide, Gellan Gum, Sodium Citrate, 1,2-Hexanediol, Sodium Isostearate, Xanthan Gum, Pentaerythrityl Tetra-Di-T-Butyl Hydroxyhydrocinnamate, Caprylyl Glycol, Polysorbate 20, Ethylhexylglycerin, Titanium Dioxide (CI 77891), Iron Oxides (CI 77491).
how_to_use: Suggested Usage:.-Apply your shadow as opaque or as sheer as you desire. .-For a statement look: Using a flat eyeshadow brush, apply the darker shade of your duo in patting motions all over the lid, packing on the pigment precisely..-Add the lighter shade to the center of the lid for a layered, dimensional effect..-For a subtle look: Swirl your fingertip into the pan and apply product to the lid with light pressing motions for a scattered-light effect...Artistry Tip:.-Patrick loves brightening the inner corners of the eyes with the lighter shade from the Talk to My Team duo.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Blue eyes, Dry skin
reviews.review_text: The new Patrick Ta Eyeshadow Duo is a beautiful and effective product. The eyeshadow formula is creamy and ultra pigmented as the sparkles are truly multidimensional. Since I am a busy student, I love having an easy and elegant eye look, which is made simple using this eyeshadow duo. Each version has complimentary shades, so you can create a more layered and complex look or just have a simple single shimmery shade. I love to use a single shade as it always looks effortless, yet still extremely elevated. The luxurious packaging is very sleek and elegant. Most importantly, it is very secure, so I don't have to worry about the eyeshadow breaking. Overall, I highly recommend this product as I prefer a versatile and smaller selection of shades compared to large and bulky palettes. This review was collected as part of a promotion.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Green eyes, brunette hair, Medium skin tone, Dry skin
reviews.review_text: I picked up Still At the Club and We Need Better Lighting.   Still At The Club: These formulas remind me a lot of PML special shades. the top is comparable to the astral formula, with slightly finer glitter and a bit more of a base. It's beautiful. The bottom is comparable to the blitz formula. It's super smooth and highly pigmented, and falls between a satin and a shimmer. I absolutely love this duo and would give it 5 stars.   We Need Better Lighting: Both of these are toppers. The glitters are more substantial than those in the UD Moondust formula. They look really beautiful on the eye, BUT, I much prefer both formulas in the SATC duo. It's still really pretty, and I'd give it 3.5 stars, just because of the comparison.   I wish it was more apparent that this collection includes multiple formulas. They could have done a much better job marketing, and I think people would have been happier if they knew what exactly they were getting before ordering.

reviews.review_text: This is a beautiful mini palette. The price is not so beautiful... The ONLY reason I bought  this is because I had $10 in points to use, making it cheaper than the Urban Decay Moon Dust singles. While this color combo is stunning on my skin tone, and I can apply them with my fingers and literally be done, is it really worth $42 (I paid $32 + tax with my points)? I found the Moira Chroma Light Shadow in How Charming to be comparable and only $7. I still have to give this 4 out of 5 stars for texture, ease of use, color saturation, and packaging. It does wear well with the Clinique eyeshadow primer (the little green compact) and lasted all day (over 8 hours). If you're a Patrick Ta super fan, or you just can't live without one or all of the shades, then treat yourself. But please, don't feel pressure or compelled by YouTube influencers or even reviews. Buy it because you love the color(s), and you're going to wear it. Then it's worth it. If $42 is gonna wreck you, check out Moira. The formula really is high-end, and the colors are STUNNING.

On the very left, I swatched an indie brand‚Äôs $12 duo-chrome shade (Ambitious from Adriana Nichole Cosmetics) for comparison and as you can see, it has way better pigment and payoff. reviews.review_text: I purchased these directly from Patrick Ta's website.  I think a lot of people are justifiably angry over rising prices and the recent occurrance of Patrick Ta's other eyeshadows growing mold.  However, I decided to take a chance on these particular eyeshadows because I get eyelid irritation easily from other eyeshadows (probably from ingredients such as talc, bismuth oxychloride, and benzoic acid), and I noticed this particular formula didn't have any of the ingredients I believe I'm reacting to.  I'm happy to report that I had no irritation from this formula.  The lighter shade in Talk to My Team reminds me of Frog from Colourpop.  There was minimal fallout from this duo as well as the duo Still at the Club.  However, the duo We Need Better Lighting had a lot of fallout.  Overall, I am satisfied, but if you can use other eyeshadow formulas just fine, then you definitely don't need to spend more money on something that is easily dupable in colors and sparkle effect by cheaper companies.

reviews.review_title: Wanted to love it, but I emphatically DO NOT!
reviews.review_buyer_description: Hazel eyes, Normal skin
reviews.review_text: Opening this stunning eyeshadow duo was an emotional experience and I couldn't wait to get it on my face! I have only tried one other product from Patrick Ta and his packaging is so glamorous, so enticing. The issue is that the eyeshadow inside doesn't match the quality of the case it comes in. It's not that I don't find it absolutely beautiful, I do, but it's difficult to apply and irritates my eyes.   When I first opened the duo Do You Know Who I Am? I was in awe and had to swatch each shade. My fingertips were coated in two distinct colors, but when I transferred each one to the back of my hand, I was a little let down at how the sparkle was all I saw and that they looked identical. Okay, sometimes it takes a bit of layering. That worked OKAY.  When the time came to test them on my face, I decided to go for a soft eyeshadow brush that I would normally choose for glitter shadows. That was a mistake because it just didn't pick up. When I got enough to apply to my eyelids, more got on my cheeks than my eye area. I decided to start over with eye primer and a powder barrier on my cheeks. That helped, but I had to switch out my brush to a firmer one. This just wasn't going well and I could see the primer so much that I instead chose a liquid eyeshadow and to use the Patrick Ta shadows as topper. At this point, I gave up and left it subpar for the day.  The most success I've had with this duo is to apply with my fingers over a liquid eyeshadow. I can't seem to make it work to my standards otherwise and I am an experienced make-up lover. I went to cosmetology AND esthetician school and have been obsessed with makeup for over 25 years! It shouldn't be so difficult with such a prestigious brand!   The worst part? All day long while wearing these eyeshadows, I have gritty particles in my eyes. Irritation from makeup makes me not want to wear it. As lovely as this product looks, it's not my friend and I cannot in good conscience recommend it to anyone after my experience.

reviews.review_text: As a beauty advocate and someone that loves doing fun eyeshadow look I was captivated by this stunning eyeshadow duo from Patrick Ta Beauty. I am a huge supporter of this brandon particular for their luxurious makeup products. The formula of these eyeshadows blend in like a dream. I especially like shimmer and glitter shades to add a pop of sparkle. The Major Dimension Eye Illusion Eyeshadow Duo I received was in the shade ‚ÄúI‚Äôm with her.‚Äù The colors are what I would wear to go to a party or concert in particular. They both complement each other in term of shades but they can be used separately depending on the occasion. I didn‚Äôt have much eyeshadow fallout while using them which is a bonus for me. The packaging and mirror is always a Patrick Ta Beauty staple. Overall I recommend this to anyone who like glitz and glam.

I had the opportunity to test Patrick Ta's Major Dimension Eye Illusion Eyeshadow Duo in the shade Do You Know Who I Am? for this past week. The packaging is luxurious and very similar to the components used for the blush and bronzer duos. However, it is really easy to smudge the outer packaging with your fingers. As for the eyeshadows themselves, they are absolutely gorgeous and give a lot of sparkle and shimmer to the eye. The formula is more on the dry side and the glitters are also hard to get off with the skin with just regular micellar water. I would say the shade on top is a rose gold, while the shade on the bottom is more of a bronze gold. Unfortunately for me, I have pigmented eyelids and honestly both shades look the same on them. There was also some fallout when I applied these to my lids. For the duo I received, I also noticed that it took more effort to pick up the pigment from the bottom pan. Overall, I agree that this is a very expensive eyeshadow duo for $42, but the quality is good. I would recommend this people who love shimmery eyes for a night out. In addition, if you have brown eyelids like me, I would opt for a different color duo if you want two distinct shades on your lids.

The packaging is  pretty, the shadow is so creamy, there is minimal fallout, the color payoff is intense, and the mirror is useful. I found that it works best if I apply it with my fingers as a finishing touch to add some intensity and sparkle. I put a neutral brown color all over my lid and crease before applying this shadow on top of my lid with my fingers, and it looked awesome. reviews.review_title: Gorgeous shades, but be ready for fallout
reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, Dry skin
reviews.review_text: I was excited to test out the new Major Dimension Eye Illusion Eyeshadow Duos by Patrick Ta in 'Still At The Club'. This review was collected as part of a promotion, however that does not affect how I feel about the product. My initial impression, I was blown away at how gorgeous the colors are and that this duo in particular is so universally flattering. Top shade is purple leaning taupe, bottom shade is a deep rich chocolate brown. Both have multi dimensional glitter reflects and can be worn separately or layered; my picture shows them separately then combined with the top/lighter shade swatched over the bottom. The top shade definitely has more of a chalky feel while the bottom is smoother. It is worth noting at first application the top shade (regardless of if it was on top of the other or alone) had little to no fallout. However, within 3-4 hours, I did notice quite a bit of sparkle all over my face, and not just under my eyes - it was all over, which was quite disappointing. I did not experience the fallout with the bottom shade alone. I understand sparkle shadows will have some amount of fallout, but this was more than any shadow I have tried in recent memory. I love shadows that give that wet look even when they are dry and the taupe shade definitely delivers that, but at the cost of fallout. I don't use/have eye primer (just use concealer) so I wonder if I try primer if it will yield better results. But, since I typically don't, I was not going to change up my routine just for one eyeshadow duo. I will continue to use this since it's really beautiful - but not an everyday shadow for me due to the fallout. I do think the shades could be everyday shades though, so if I can figure out a way to get less fallout I hope this could become an everyday product for me.

If you want a more bold look use your finger. I love that you can use these as a wash of color or build them up to get a more statement look! Very creamy and easy to blend into other shades. These are extremely high quality! Is it for everyone‚Äôs budget, no. If you want to splurge then I would say go for it cause you won‚Äôt be disappointed in pigmentation or quality. These will last you a long time as it‚Äôs a good size pan for each shade. I don‚Äôt think there‚Äôs anything on the market currently that could compare to these in pigmentation, shine, and no kickback. This is a 10/10 for me!

reviews.review_text: The packaging of the eyeshadow duo palette is sleek and modern that complements the shades inside. The palette feels luxurious and sturdy, with the magnetic closure providing a sense of security when it‚Äôs tossed into your makeup bag.  Upon opening the palette, the colors immediately catch your eye. The left shade is a shimmery, warm bronze-rose gold that feels perfect for daytime glam or as a versatile base color. The right shade is a deeper, rich berry-rose gold, ideal for creating a more intense, glamorous look for the evening. The shades are highly reflective with a metallic finish, giving them a luxurious feel.  The texture of the shadows is buttery and smooth, gliding on the lids effortlessly. They blend like a dream, making it easy to achieve a seamless transition between the two shades. Even with minimal effort, you can create a sophisticated, well-blended look. Whether you‚Äôre using a fluffy brush for a diffused effect or a flat brush for packing on color, the formula works beautifully in both scenarios.  This palette is perfect for someone who loves soft glam with a touch of luxury. The palette truly stands out in terms of pigmentation, wearability, and its luxurious presentation. reviews.review_title: Patrick Ta Major Dimension Eye Illusion Duo: Too M
reviews.review_buyer_description: Green eyes, blonde hair, Normal skin
reviews.review_text: As someone who has been in the beauty and cosmetics industry for nearly 40 years, I‚Äôve experienced a wide range of eyeshadow products across high-end, drugstore, and direct sales brands. I understand the allure of shimmer shades, and I recognize that some professional makeup artists prefer using just two shades for specific looks. However, in my professional experience, most artists strike a balance between matte and shimmer shades, often using a touch of shimmer to enhance the eyes without overwhelming them.  Unfortunately, the two shades in this Patrick Ta Beauty Major Dimension Eye Illusion Duo in Rose Gold Sparkle didn‚Äôt meet my expectations. I found them to be too sheer and similar in tone, which diminished the overall impact. I tried them under different lighting conditions and applied them as recommended, but the colors blended too closely to deliver the contrast I was hoping for. Personally, I prefer more defined colors, especially with matte shades, as they offer more versatility and depth.  The amount of shimmer in this palette felt excessive for such sheer pigmentation. As a woman in my 60s, I found that the shimmer settled into fine lines and creases, making them more noticeable, which is a common concern for mature skin. I believe this product might be better suited for younger individuals with smoother skin, but for more mature skin types, it‚Äôs not flattering. Additionally, I don‚Äôt think these shades work well for fair skin tones, as the colors didn‚Äôt show up prominently. Darker skin tones might have better luck picking up the pigmentation.  When it comes to pricing, I feel this product is on the expensive side for a duo palette. For the cost, I would have expected more variety or perhaps the inclusion of complementary shades like a blush or highlighter. While the sleek packaging and the shades themselves look attractive, the performance didn‚Äôt match the price point in my opinion.  In conclusion, I wouldn‚Äôt recommend this eyeshadow duo for mature clien

reviews.review_text: Upon first opening these up they look stunning.  The packaging is the classic Patrick Ta gold compact. The top shade is a metallic copper, and the second shade is a metallic fuchsia, both of which look great with my blue eyes.  These both looked great in the pan and I was eager to try them.  These shadows are smooth to the touch and while they look more metallic, they have micro bits of glitter. I was excited because these two shades reminded me of two shades that were in the Huda Beauty Rose Gold Remastered Palette. I loved that palette and am still sad that it was discontinued!  This is where things took a turn, the color payoff was not what I was expecting.  At first they looked great, but the shades very quickly wore off and after 4 hours, I had glitter in places I didn‚Äôt apply the shadow.  I also noticed that when I was applying my liquid eyeliner that the shadow was lifting off onto my liquid liner brush. I‚Äôll now never be able to use that liquid liner without getting glitter on me.  IT also was not easy to wash off afterward.  I think I washed my face three times and still had flecks of glitter on my face.  Bottom line: These may be great for someone who doesn‚Äôt mind glitter or if you are only going to wear them for a short time but given that the price is $42 for two shadows I wouldn‚Äôt recommend it.  There are plenty of other brands that offer similar shades in full palettes for a better price.

The gleam is subtle yet eye-catching, without causing flashback in pictures‚Äîgreat for events.  üéÄ Application: You can use a brush for a soft, glittery look or your fingers for a more intense payoff. reviews.review_text: Talk about sparkle!  Just in time for holiday looks, Patrick Ta releases this line of duos from the Major Dimemsion collection.  Do You Know Who I Am is a duo of a coppery gold and lighter sunlight gold, really good combo for blue eyes.  The orange/copper tone being a complimentary to blue, really brings out the color of my eyes.  But first things first- the packaging.  Beautiful classic PT rose gold sleek metallic box and also palette itself which includes a mirror.  The shadow itself is so beautiful, it's almost a shame to mess up the embossed logo.  Swatching reveals a light colored base with heavy shimmer.  With a brush, you get a scattered topper but applying with a finger is pure metallic wet-looking shine.  Gorgeous!  These two shades can be used alone, together or to to top another look.  I can even see the lighter shade being used as an inner corner highlight if you really wanted it to shimmer.  Wear time with and without primer was at least eight hours without much fallout, but I have drier skin so I usually don't have issues with that.  I received this product as part of a promotion.
